title: Relocate Compression-Trust from Synchronism to Web4 Context
implementation_notes: Content archived, replaced with principle-only statement

rationale.philosophical: Compression-trust patterns, while emergent in all information systems, are presented with implementation-specific framing (web trust, digital signatures) that belongs in Web4 engineering rather than Synchronism's universal principles.
rationale.mrh_alignment: Synchronism describes MRH-transcendent patterns. Web4 implements these patterns within our specific MRH (human-AI, Earth, 2025). The current presentation conflates universal principle with specific implementation.
rationale.clarity: Removing implementation-specific content from foundational philosophy improves clarity and prevents readers from conflating engineering choices with universal laws.

steps.action: Archive section 4.13 content to preserve the work
Add brief note in section 4 about information system properties
steps.content: Information systems naturally evolve mechanisms for compression (efficiency) and validation (trust), manifesting differently at each scale and within each MRH.

steps.details: Ensure any references to compression-trust point to appropriate context

benefits: Cleaner separation between science (Synchronism) and engineering (Web4)
Reduced confusion about what is fundamental vs implementation
risks: Loss of important insight if not properly preserved
